result.execSummary:
The defendant James A Moten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Report to Racine Vocational Ministry. Participate in the Fatherhood Program at the YMCA. Under go a mental health assessment and follow through with the recommendations. Engage in a domestic violence program. No contact with R.L. (person, property, residence or family). Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.

**CORRECTED 8/22/2019:  To reflect 73 days of credit for time served.  Defendant has 438 days of credit in 15CF981 and received 365 days of credit, remainder of credit will be applied in 15CF1485.**

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with R.L., J.L. or Ms.Pinkowski.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent including anger management counseling and abuser counseling.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: count 1 but consecutive to current sentence
